p: As shown in Figure 2 and Table 1, MAYV cases have been found in Latin America and the Caribbean, with the highest number of cases occurring in Brazil and Peru. Of the 901 reported cases of MAYV, approximately 843 confirmed and presumptive autochthonous cases and 16 imported cases were identified in academic literature, and the remaining 42 cases were reported exclusively by a health authority ( 1, 4, 8, 14- 37). Epidemiological bulletins from the ministries of health in Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Ecuador, French Guiana, Haiti, Mexico, Panama, Peru, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, and Venezuela made no mention of the presence of Mayaro.
